description: Dive into "Majestic Castles of Milan: A Journey Through Time" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Majestic Castles of Milan: A Journey Through Time

places.generalDescription: Sala delle Asse, located within the castle's central courtyard, is a must-see for those looking to explore without visiting the museums. This historical site is open to the public and free to visit. Leonardo da Vinci's stunning work can be admired here, making it a worthwhile stop for any visitor.

sources.snippet: Today, it houses the Civic Museums that hosts works by Bellini, Antonello da Messina and Mantegna, but also the Egyptian Museum, the Museum of Ancient Art, the Piet√† Rondanini, the famous unfinished sculpture by Michelangelo, the Pinacoteca and the Sala delle Asse by Leonardo da Vinci. Donot miss the majestic grounds within the Castle, split into three courtyards: Piazza d'Armi where the soldiers stayed, the courtyard of the Rocchetta, the most protected section of the castle where the treasure of the duchy was kept, and finally the Ducal Court, characterized by the beautiful garden with a long pool in the middle.
sources.shortName: Castello Sforzesco in Milan: what to visit

sources.snippet: This is one of the largest and most symbolic castles in European history, every corner is imbued with personality and interest, such as the famous Venetian knots that are part of the decoration of the Sala delle Asse, a work whose tree branches intertwined by Leonardo Da Vinci, make up one of the emblematic spaces of the castle.
sources.shortName: Castillo Sforzesco in Milan Tickets and Tours

places.name: Sala delle Asse

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Fantastic news! The Municipality has approved the technical and economic feasibility project for the restoration of this wonder. The construction site will begin in the first months of 2025 and the cost is estimated at just over one million six hundred thousand euros, financed partly by the municipality's own resources and partly by a banking foundation. The intervention must be completed by the beginning of 2026, in order to make the hall accessible during the period in which the Winter Olympics will take place and therefore visitable by the numerous tourists present in the city for the games.

(Original)
Fantastica notizia! Il Comune ha approvato il progetto di fattibilit√† tecnica ed economica per il restauro di questa meraviglia. Il cantiere inizier√† nei primi mesi del 2025 e il costo √® stimato intorno a poco pi√π di un milione e seicentomila euro, finanziati in parte da risorse proprie del comune e in parte da una fondazione bancaria. L'intervento dovr√† concludersi entro l'inizio del 2026, in modo da rendere la sala accessibile nel periodo in cui si svolgeranno le olimpiadi invernali e quindi visitabile dai numerosi turisti presenti in citt√† per i giochi.

(Translated by Google) Leonardo... That's enough.

(Original)
Leonardo... Basta questo.

places.address: Sforzesco Castle, Piazza Castello, 20121 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Sforzesco Castle, one of the largest castles in Europe, is a magnificent medieval-Renaissance fortress that stands as a historic symbol of Milan. Built between the 14th and 15th centuries for defensive purposes, it now houses various museums showcasing significant artworks by renowned artists such as da Vinci and Michelangelo.

sources.snippet: The main highlight of our trip was the Sforzesco Castle and the Sempione Park. These two attractions sit side by side in the central core of downtown Milan and are easily accessed by a subway, bus, and trolley. The castle itself offers free admission all the time.
sources.shortName: Castles, Skyscrapers, and Prosciutto in Milan, Italy

places.name: Sforzesco Castle

reviews.text:
Very beautiful castle with lots of exhibitions on different topics. We spent hours there. At the end it was too much input.
Every first and third Tuesday of the month the entrance is free. Not sure if the whole day or after 2pm (read different information). We arrived at 2:30pm and it was definitely free. Closing time was 5:30pm.

Historic castle belonging to the royal family of Milan.  We enjoyed the massive size of the castle, had learned a lot during our guided tour of Milan, which took us through the castle.

I believe there's a lot to see here, but our guided tour took us through rather quickly explaining everything we needed to know about the historic castle.

Tremendous castle museum, well worth spending a morning or afternoon here. Packed full with art of every kind, from paintings to sculpture to furniture and other material culture items. Buildings themselves also of interest. Lockers in the basement to store bags, which are not allowed in the paid areas. Very good value. Could make more money by charging more and having a bigger gift shop.
